page.title: 03Ecology Ref 02760084
page.content: This area enjoys a moderately mild climate with higher than average rainfall,mists persisting in the river valleys.Strong winds are common, particularly on high ground. Dartmoor National Park is responsible for maintaining many footpaths for walkers to enjoy the countryside, and in 1981 it bought Blackingstone Rock to preserve it and to allow the public access.The Nature Conservancy Council maintains a Site of Special Scientific Interest in the Trenchford Valley consisting of a long narrow strip of marshy valley in the midst of agricultral land and plantations, forming a valuable habitat for many native marsh dwelling plants and animals.The Devon banks bounding the roads also provide a habitat for numerous hedgerow plants,birds and animals.
